    Le langage Ruby

    https://www.ruby-lang.org/fr/

    Ruby Programming Language

    https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/

    Ruby is a dynamic, open-source programming language designed with a focus on simplicity and productivity. Its elegant syntax is easy to read and write, making it a popular choice for developers who value clean and concise code.

    Ruby supports a wide range of programming paradigms, including object-oriented, functional, and imperative styles. It is particularly well-known for its use in web development, especially with the Ruby on Rails framework, which simplifies building robust web applications.

    Key Features of Ruby:

    • Dynamic Typing: Ruby is dynamically typed, meaning you don't need to declare variable types explicitly.

    • Garbage Collection: Automatic memory management ensures efficient resource handling.

    • Rich Standard Library: Ruby provides a comprehensive set of built-in libraries for tasks like file handling, networking, and data manipulation.

    • Metaprogramming: Ruby allows developers to write code that can modify itself, enabling highly flexible and reusable solutions.

    Example Code:

  5. People also ask
    How do I run a Ruby program?
    To write and run Ruby programs, you need to install Ruby on your system. Follow the instructions on the official Ruby website. Ruby is dynamically typed, meaning you donâ€™t need to declare variable types explicitly. Common data types include integers, floats, strings, and booleans.

    Introduction to Programming in Ruby - ironcoders.com

    ironcoders.com
    What is Ruby programming language?
    Ruby is a general-purpose programming language. It was designed with an emphasis on programming productivity and simplicity. In Ruby, everything is an object, including primitive data types. It was developed in the mid-1990s by Yukihiro "Matz" Matsumoto in Japan.

    Ruby (programming language) - Wikipedia

    en.wikipedia.org
    Why should you learn Ruby?
    Ruby includes a lot of key features like its Object-Oriented, Dynamic Typing, Readable Syntax, and a large Standard Library collection. Why to Learn Ruby? Ruby is a simple and expressive programming language, which provides various advantages to programmers, especially in fields like web development, automation tasks, scripting, etc.

    Is Ruby good for programmer productivity & fun?
    Matsumoto has said that Ruby is designed for programmer productivity and fun, following the principles of good user interface design. At a Google Tech Talk in 2008 he said, "I hope to see Ruby help every programmer in the world to be productive, and to enjoy programming, and to be happy.

    Ruby (programming language) - Wikipedia

    en.wikipedia.org
    Is Ruby a good language for web development?
    Its vast ecosystem of libraries (gems) and the powerful Ruby on Rails framework make it easy to launch full-featured web apps quickly. However, Rubyâ€™s weaknesses include slower execution speed compared to compiled languages like C++ or Go.
